posts.content:
Hi,
I am trying to replicate a folding door cooker, I have seen the photos posted by type21f back in April last year and they are great but if anyone can post or send me some of the cooker out of the cupboard and from all angles that would be a great help.
I can't get photos in the short term but if you want to borrow mine to make copies then that could work, depending on your location.
Thanks for the offer but I am in Spain between Malaga and Gibraltar so as with everything I do I have to rely on the interweb for info.

I will look what pictures I posted and see if I hsve any more.
There was a poster put up pictures of one he had made.
Neil Barker had some case parts at one time.
I bought a spare black topped 63 fixed case oneo do this but never got round to making one.
I want a Devonette door cooker as used in the Torvette...
BUT this does not have a grill and I love toast. .. So maybe I will use what I have or my Moortown cooker.
LOL..

I will look for the link and my pictures
G
